Articles.Content:
Last night I decided to 3d print a random redditor's KSP spaceship. I had such a great response that someone mentioned this forum and my mind has been since mesmerized by all the unique designs. If you have access to a printer, you can print it yourself here:

https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:223355

I'd like to print as many as possible so I'm running a short contest to print the highest voted craft here: reddit post

I'm hoping the vehicle voted is indicative of the quality shown in this forum!
The printed model does have some quality to it. The lander itself is very clever, too.

Which 3D printer do you use? How much does it cost? Does a 3D scanner exist? Can one "photocopy" something?

PS: Please PM me if you don't mind, I seem to be unable to bookmark his page.

Not sure what printer the OP uses, but 3D printers are now available for around $2000 and up. Check out Makerbot, they sell cheap kits and finished printers, and also sell a 3D scanner. There are others, too.
I heard a $499 customer-oriented 3D printer is coming out this year.
